artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 482.5; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets; beach scene; seated young man at left in profile from PR, wearing a white blouse and lavender skirt with white floral patterns, with hair tied on top of his head, and a brown, green and white fan resting against his leg; two standing topless woman with long loose hair at right, one wearing a blue flowered skirt and the other wearing a red skirt with stars and sunbursts; shells and fish on beach between man and women
dimension: 14 3/4 × 9 15/16 in. (37.47 × 25.24 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫工円活 {horikō Enkatsu}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sketches by Yoshitoshi (Yoshitoshi manga 芳年漫画)
title: Picture of the Exiled Councilor Yukihira Ason Amusing Himself with the Two Divers Murasame and Matsukaze at Suma Beach
